name: Triangular Fibrocartilage Complex (TFCC) Avulsion with Ulnar Impaction Syndrome
chief_complaint: I have sharp pain on the pinky side of my wrist that gets worse when I twist or grip things
symptoms: Clicking or popping sensation with rotation

lab_results.MRI_wrist: TFCC peripheral tear with avulsion fragment, positive ulnar variance

treatment: Arthroscopic TFCC repair with ulnar shortening osteotomy
prognosis: Good with surgical intervention, though may have 10-15% permanent loss of rotational mobility
description: A complex injury involving both traumatic avulsion of the TFCC from its ulnar attachment and chronic ulnar impaction due to positive ulnar variance, causing degenerative changes in the ulnocarpal joint
risk_factors: Repetitive rotational movements (e.g., mechanics, tennis players)
